thread.title: Winona Ryder‚Äôs Facial Expressions Deserve Their Own SAG Award
thread.title_full: Winona Ryder‚Äôs Facial Expressions Deserve Their Own SAG Award

author: Karen Mizoguchi / People
title: Winona Ryder‚Äôs Facial Expressions Deserve Their Own SAG Award
text:
The many faces of Winona Ryder were the true winners of the 2017 Screen Actors Guild Awards .
No one was more surprised than the actress to hear her Stranger Things costar‚Äôs David Harbour‚Äôs acceptance speech for the Netflix cast‚Äôs Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series win .
Harbour‚Äôs impassioned message had Ryder making a variety of expressions, including a raised fist and ‚Äúdeer in the headlights‚Äù look, and viewers couldn‚Äôt help but notice them.
‚ÄúThis is heavy,‚Äù Ryder could be heard saying while handing off the Actor statuette to Harbour.
The many faces of Winona Ryder. üôåüòÇ #SAGAwards pic.twitter.com/oqegdrXWlX 
‚Äî Entertainment Weekly (@EW) January 30, 2017 
I think every emotion humanly possible just passed through Winona Ryder's face #SAGAwards 
‚Äî Haley (@h4ley_m) January 30, 2017 
Someone needs to make a gif of Winona Ryder's facial reactions right now. #sagawards #StrangerThings pic.twitter.com/GkDajzIto5 
‚Äî Margit Detweiler (@Margit) January 30, 2017 
Winona Ryder deserves a SAG award for her emotional journey on stage just now. #sagawards pic.twitter.com/Ge1JOp5Ju2 
‚Äî A B B Y (@stabby) January 30, 2017 
Going to have to rewind that #StrangerThings speech. I was too distracted by what was going on with #WinonaRyder 's face. #sag #sagawards 
‚Äî Josie (@jojophinemo) January 30, 2017 
And Winona Ryder in gif form because I'm just having too much fun with this & I need something to make me smile. #sagawards #StrangerThings pic.twitter.com/3qQZ9jzG34 
‚Äî Claire (@Clairvoyant94) January 30, 2017 
‚ÄúIn light of all that‚Äôs going on in the world today it‚Äôs difficult to celebrate the already celebrated Stranger Things . Great acting can change the world,‚Äù Harbour said on behalf of the cast.
‚ÄúA call to arms from our fellow craftsmen and women to go deeper and through our heart battle against fear, self-centeredness, exclusivity of our predominantly narcissistic culture. And through our craft, cultivate an empathetic and more understanding society by revealing intimate truths that serve as a forceful reminder to folks that when they feel broken and afraid and tired they are not alone,‚Äù he continued.
‚Äú We are united in that we are all human beings and we are all together on this horrible painful, joyous exciting and mysterious ride that is being alive.‚Äù

Ryder and costar Millie Bobby Brown were both nominated in the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series category.
This article originally appeared on People.com
